Your forecasts are as accurate as a weather map in a hurricane.

Founders love dashboards‚Äîuntil they realize they‚Äôre just colorful spreadsheets filled with bad decisions.
If you're still obsessing over "win rates" and "pipeline velocity," congrats‚Äîyou‚Äôve mastered the art of looking busy while staying blind.

Forget those vanity metrics‚Äîthese are the RevOps numbers that actually keep your business alive:-

 Sales Cycle Compression Rate ‚Äì Closing deals is great. But are you closing them faster over time? If not, your sales efficiency is breaking, not scaling.

 Rep-Specific Deal Slippage ‚Äì If one rep always has deals ‚Äúpushed to next quarter,‚Äù they‚Äôre not closing‚Äîthey‚Äôre collecting excuses.

 Pricing Deviation Index (PDI) ‚Äì You say ‚Äúpremium pricing,‚Äù but your deals keep closing at a 40% discount. That‚Äôs not premium, that‚Äôs a clearance sale.

 Lead-to-Customer CAC Payback ‚Äì Some lead sources look profitable‚Äîuntil you realize they take forever to pay back CAC. Congrats, you just paid to lose money.

 Ghost Pipeline Ratio ‚Äì Deals in late stages that magically disappear without being marked lost? That‚Äôs not a sales pipeline. That‚Äôs a fantasy novel.

 Sales Efficiency Decay Rate ‚Äì If every new rep is less efficient than the last, your onboarding is a disaster, not a process.

 Rep Ramp Time vs. First Dollar Closed ‚Äì Time to quota is nice, but how fast can a new rep close anything? That‚Äôs your real onboarding health check.

 Proposal-to-Close Ratio ‚Äì If your reps are sending out 10 proposals to close 1 deal, they‚Äôre not selling. They‚Äôre just emailing PDFs into the void.

 Renewal Expansion vs. Shrinkage Velocity ‚Äì If your customers shrink faster than they expand, your revenue is on life support. Fix your onboarding and retention.

‚è≥ Time-to-Forecast Accuracy ‚Äì If your forecast only becomes accurate in the last two weeks of the quarter, you don‚Äôt have a forecast. You have wishful thinking.

Most RevOps reports are just storytelling with numbers. The real question is: Are your numbers telling the right story?

That‚Äôs where Clientell comes in.

Our AI doesn‚Äôt just track these metrics‚Äîit fixes them before they become a problem.
 Deals dragging? We find and eliminate bottlenecks in your sales cycle.
 Reps sandbagging? Our AI flags deal slippage before it happens.
 Discounting out of control? We tell you exactly where pricing leaks are.
 Forecasting still a guessing game? We replace gut feelings with real pipeline intelligence.

Founders don‚Äôt need more dashboards. They need ANSWERS.

Want to set these up in your Salesforce? Or need a ready-to-use template to get started? Drop a comment, and I‚Äôll send it your way!

What‚Äôs the dumbest sales metric you‚Äôve seen?

AI in 2025: Shaping the Future of Work, Creativity, and Innovation

As we enter 2025, AI is no longer just a buzzword‚Äîit's a fundamental driver of transformation across industries. From automating tasks to enabling deeper insights, AI is making a profound impact on the way we work and live. 

Here are a few trends I'm excited to watch unfold this year:
AI-Powered Personalization: Expect AI to take personalized experiences to the next level‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs in e-commerce, healthcare, or education. Advanced algorithms are helping tailor content and solutions to individual needs with unprecedented precision.

AI and Creativity: AI isn‚Äôt just for efficiency anymore. We‚Äôre seeing it enhance creativity, from generating art to assisting in music composition and film production. It‚Äôs opening new frontiers for creators to collaborate with technology in fresh and innovative ways.|

Ethical AI: With rapid advancements come important conversations about responsible AI use. In 2025, organizations will continue focusing on ethical AI frameworks to ensure fairness, transparency, and inclusivity are embedded in every algorithm and solution.

AI in Healthcare: The healthcare industry is transforming with AI-driven diagnostics, personalized treatments, and precision medicine. We‚Äôre seeing more powerful AI tools that can detect diseases earlier and improve patient outcomes in ways that were once unimaginable.

The Future of Work: AI is reshaping the workplace, from intelligent virtual assistants to AI-driven project management tools. These technologies are not replacing jobs‚Äîthey're empowering individuals to work smarter and drive greater productivity.

Let‚Äôs embrace the future!  The question isn't if AI will change the world‚Äîit‚Äôs how will we adapt, collaborate, and harness its full potential to build a better tomorrow?

#2025

Windows 11 is saying goodbye to its ‚Äúsuggested actions‚Äù feature. 

What‚Äôs that?

If you‚Äôve ever copied a phone number or date and seen a pop-up suggesting a call or calendar event, it‚Äôs that one.

It was introduced in 2022 and was meant to save time. But Microsoft has decided it‚Äôs time for a change.

The feature‚Äôs being phased out, possibly because not many people used it. But of course, there‚Äôs something else on the way (for some people anyway).

Microsoft is rolling out a replacement called ‚ÄòClick to Do,‚Äô an AI-powered tool that takes suggestions to the next level. It‚Äôll offer smarter, context-based actions to help streamline tasks.

The catch? It‚Äôs only available on newer Copilot+ PCs with the hardware needed to support advanced AI features.

Unfortunately, older devices will just lose the ‚Äúsuggested actions‚Äù menu without a replacement.

If you‚Äôll miss this feature, you can let Microsoft know through the Feedback Hub app. For most people though, this change might pass by unnoticed.

What do you think... will you miss ‚Äúsuggested actions,‚Äù? Or are you ready to embrace AI-powered tools like ‚ÄòClick to Do‚Äô?

7 Sales Secrets They Don‚Äôt Want You to Know (But Your Prospects Will Love) 
Want to close deals like a Jedi Master? Ditch the outdated playbook.

Here‚Äôs the unfiltered truth about modern sales (that actually works):

1. Reverse Psychology 101: Ask for a ‚ÄúNo‚Äù to Get a ‚ÄúYes‚Äù
Bad: ‚ÄúWould you like a demo?‚Äù
Genius: ‚ÄúWould it be a horrible idea to show you how this works in 90 seconds?‚Äù

Prospects love feeling in control. Let them say ‚Äúno‚Äù to the wrong thing so they say ‚Äúyes‚Äù to the right one.

2. Steal This Line: ‚ÄúWhat Would Happen If‚Ä¶‚Äù
Drop this bomb: ‚ÄúWhat do you think would happen if you solved [X problem] tomorrow?‚Äù
Suddenly, they‚Äôre pitching themselves on your solution. You? Just smile and take notes.

3. Master the Art of Time Respect (Even If You‚Äôre Lying)
Start cold calls with: ‚ÄúI‚Äôll keep this quick‚Äîpromise.‚Äù
Then hit them with a 30-second story so compelling they‚Äôll ask to keep talking.

4. Future-Proof Your Pipeline: Turn ‚ÄúNo‚Äù Into ‚ÄúNot Yet‚Äù
When they say ‚ÄúCall me next quarter,‚Äù reply: ‚ÄúTotally get it! What‚Äôs one thing that would make this a slam dunk in 90 days?‚Äù
Now they‚Äôre scripting your follow-up email. Checkmate.

5. Strategic Silence (Then Strike)
Nod. Pause. Let them talk. Then hit ‚Äôem with: ‚ÄúIt sounds like [pain they didn‚Äôt mention] is killing you.‚Äù
Wait for the nervous laugh.  Now they think you‚Äôre a mind reader.

6. Sell the Vision. Let Support Clean Up the Mess.
‚ÄúDoes it integrate with your current tools? Absolutely.‚Äù (Cue frantic Slack to engineering post-sale.)
Close first, apologize never.

7. The Magic Phrase: ‚ÄúJust Out of Curiosity‚Ä¶‚Äù
Sprinkle this in: ‚ÄúJust out of curiosity‚Ä¶ how are you handling [pain point] right now?‚Äù
Translation: ‚ÄúLet me expose the gap in your process so you beg me to fix it.‚Äù

BONUS RULE: If you‚Äôre not getting ghosted, you‚Äôre not pushing hard enough.
Agree?

comments.commentText: I see parallels between this and user onboarding strategies.

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Embracing modern sales techniques can truly transform your approach. Love the strategic blend of psychology and storytelling!

postsData.content:
Sales psychology 101:

The more customers feel like you need them, the less they feel they need you.

The less they feel like you need them, the more they feel they need you.

Most of us want more business, but...

There‚Äôs a HUGE difference between wanting and needing.

The one with the least attachment to a deal usually wins.

Here‚Äôs the key:

If you are doing your job and helping your client solve a problem, alleviate pain, or achieve a desired goal by working together, then you won‚Äôt need to hard close.

They will naturally move forward because if they don‚Äôt, it‚Äôs their loss.

Doing the deal helps them, not you.

It‚Äôs your job to stay on top of them and ensure that the deal keeps moving forward because people get busy and other priorities may come up.

Persistent is different than pushy, and is critical for success in sales.

But the minute you start hard closing because you NEED the deal to hit quota or maximize comp, it comes across as desperate, unnatural, and kills trust.

Translation: Don‚Äôt have commission breath.

Customers can smell it a mile away and it will repel them instantly.

comments.commentText: persistence > desperation every time!

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Its all about building trust and value, not desperation. Persistence with integrity truly sets top salespeople apart!

Productivity isn‚Äôt just about hitting numbers but building a process that consistently drives better outcomes

Step 1: Understand your productivity metrics

It might sound boring but this is where real growth happens. Start with something like this: if it takes you 4 hours to generate $10K in pipeline, ask: How can I get 5% or 10% faster?

The reps winning right now are building systems for tracking every step so they can make quick adjustments, turning small productivity gains into big wins

James Bailey
James Bailey
postsData.content:
Growing up the biggest barrier to using computers for me was understanding what they wanted; said another way, it was always difficult to tell when something was going wrong.

It took me a long time to realize that my frustration with the tool was misplaced, a computer doesn't actually want anything, it's me who's using it because I want something. When a computer showed me something I didn't like not only would I need to know exactly where my input was wrong, but also know where the computer thought my input was wrong. I needed to know how I was wrong. That's unfair - I'm not a computer and I shouldn't have to think like one! Thankfully we recognized the interaction model with computers was poor and this frustration was a symbol of the mismatch between a computers expectations of my knowledge (really their designers) and my intentions as a human. This gap in understanding is why I think I chose to pursue a career in design.

While the time to a response has gotten shorter and shorter since I first used a computer, the distance between my desired outcome and my starting point has always maintained a great length. Right now, my younger self is feeling that distance closing at a more rapid rate. My ability to get what I want from a computer is now determined by two things: my patience and my ability to specifically articulate what I want, a skill nearly anyone in the world can learn. My inner child would have loved to be using a computer for the first time today and I think the computer that helps close that gap even faster is still being designed.

's article here highlights the enormous opportunity us designers have to capture this new way of interacting with computers. I too hope we don't constrain ourselves to a chat box.
postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! It‚Äôs fascinating how design can bridge the gap between human intention and computer response. Excited to see where this evolution leads us!

Your content needs to be REALLY good.

JavaScript Frameworks vs. Other Programming Language Frameworks ‚Äì Which One Reigns Supreme?

Choosing the right framework is crucial for any developer. While JavaScript frameworks dominate web development, other programming languages like Python, Java, and PHP offer powerful alternatives. Here‚Äôs a detailed comparison of both:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Performance & Speed

JavaScript Frameworks (React, Vue, Angular, Next.js) are optimized for high-speed frontend interactions, making web apps smooth and dynamic. With server-side options like Node.js, JavaScript can also handle backend processes efficiently.

Other Language Frameworks (Django, Spring, Laravel) often prioritize security and complex backend operations over sheer speed. While great for handling large-scale applications, they may lag in rendering dynamic user interfaces.


üü¢ Best For: JavaScript in real-time apps (e.g., chats, dashboards), while Python/Java is better for computation-heavy applications.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Scalability & Ecosystem

JavaScript Frameworks benefit from an extensive ecosystem with packages (NPM) and integrations, making it easy to scale and extend applications.

Other Frameworks like Spring (Java) or Django (Python) provide robust backend scaling but may require additional frontend solutions like React or Vue.


üü¢ Best For: JavaScript is the leader for full-stack scalability, while backend-heavy projects may lean toward Java/Python.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Ease of Learning & Development Speed

JavaScript Frameworks focus on flexibility and quick iteration, allowing rapid prototyping with minimal setup.

Other Frameworks like Laravel (PHP) and Django (Python) simplify backend logic but may require additional learning for frontend compatibility.


üü¢ Best For: JavaScript frameworks for fast development cycles; Python/Laravel for structured backend logic.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Community & Support

JavaScript has one of the largest developer communities, with active support for React, Angular, and Node.js.

Other frameworks like Django, Flask, and Laravel also have strong communities, but JavaScript‚Äôs front-end-first approach makes it more accessible for beginners.


üü¢ Best For: JavaScript leads in open-source contributions and real-time issue resolution.

5Ô∏è‚É£ Versatility & Use Cases

JavaScript (React, Vue, Angular) dominates web UI/UX, mobile apps (React Native), and even server-side (Node.js).

Other frameworks shine in domains like AI/ML (Python), enterprise solutions (Java), and content-heavy websites (PHP/Laravel).


üü¢ Best For: JavaScript in web & hybrid apps; Python/Java in AI and enterprise apps.

 Conclusion:

JavaScript frameworks excel in speed, versatility, and full-stack development, making them ideal for modern web applications. Other programming languages bring power to backend-heavy and AI-driven applications. Your choice depends on the project needs and scalability goals!
postsData.commentAdded: Great analysis! üöÄ It really highlights how crucial it is to choose the right framework based on project needs. Both worlds have so much to offer!

How many of us resist appreciation, thinking we don‚Äôt deserve it?

When you resist appreciation, you are resisting:

Your strength and growth
This is exactly what I told her.

When someone appreciates you, don‚Äôt downplay it‚Äîeven if you‚Äôre not yet where you want to be.

Celebrating micro wins is what ultimately leads to macro success.

Subconsciously, we often think we don‚Äôt deserve it. But the truth is, every bit of progress matters.

You wouldn‚Äôt check yesterday‚Äôs weather to decide if you need an umbrella today, right? 

So why are businesses still relying on outdated data to make real-time decisions?

I once worked with a retail brand that constantly battled inventory chaos‚Äîrunning out of bestsellers while slow-moving products gathered dust. Their reports were always a day late, and by the time they reacted, customers had already walked away.

We switched them to real-time analytics, and the transformation was instant. They could track demand shifts as they happened, tweak pricing dynamically, and optimize stock levels in the moment.

Result? 20% fewer stockouts, higher sales, and less waste.

This isn‚Äôt just a retail thing. Every industry today needs to move at the speed of NOW.

Banks need to stop fraud before it happens‚Äînot after the damage is done.
Marketers need to adjust campaigns on the fly‚Äînot post-mortem.
Manufacturers need instant supply chain insights‚Äînot crisis reports.

Real-time data isn‚Äôt a luxury anymore‚Äîit‚Äôs the difference between leading the game and playing catch-up.

Is your business still running on yesterday‚Äôs data? Let‚Äôs talk about it!

Top 5 JavaScript Frameworks You Must Know in 2024!

As a Full Stack Developer & UI/UX Designer, choosing the right JavaScript framework can make or break a project. Here are the top 5 frameworks, when to use them, and their key advantages:

1Ô∏è‚É£ React.js ‚Äì The UI Powerhouse

 Use When: Building dynamic, high-performance, and interactive UIs.
‚≠ê Features:
 Virtual DOM for fast rendering
 Reusable components for modular development
 Strong ecosystem (Redux, Next.js)
 Advantage: Best for scalable and SEO-friendly web apps.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Vue.js ‚Äì The Progressive Framework

 Use When: You need a lightweight and flexible frontend framework.
‚≠ê Features:
 Simple syntax & easy learning curve
 Reactive data binding
 Single File Components
 Advantage: Perfect for quick development with high reusability.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Angular ‚Äì The Enterprise Choice

 Use When: Developing large-scale, enterprise-grade applications.
‚≠ê Features:
 TypeScript-based with strict structure
 Two-way data binding
 Built-in security & dependency injection
 Advantage: Ideal for large apps needing high maintainability.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Svelte ‚Äì The Compiler-Based Innovator

 Use When: You want a modern, fast, and reactive UI with minimal boilerplate.
‚≠ê Features:
 No virtual DOM, direct compilation to vanilla JS
 Small bundle size & ultra-fast performance
 Reactive state management
 Advantage: Best for ultra-lightweight, high-speed apps.

5Ô∏è‚É£ Next.js ‚Äì The SEO & Performance King

 Use When: You need a full-stack solution for web apps with server-side rendering.
‚≠ê Features:
 Hybrid static & server rendering (SSG & SSR)
 API routes for backend integration
 Automatic code splitting for faster loads
 Advantage: Best for performance-focused, SEO-friendly web applications.

 Choosing the right JavaScript framework depends on your project needs, team expertise, and scalability requirements!

postsData.content:
Stop Hijacking Your Sales

Scaling sales isn‚Äôt about luck, leads, or finding the ‚Äúperfect‚Äù rep.

It‚Äôs about having a repeatable, structured system that takes the guesswork out of growth.

But here‚Äôs the challenge‚Äîmost are unknowingly making sales harder than it needs to be.

If you‚Äôre struggling to get consistent revenue, it‚Äôs usually because:

 There‚Äôs no repeatable sales system in place
 Salespeople are expected to build AND sell from scratch
 Every deal feels different because there‚Äôs no structured process
 There‚Äôs no way to track or optimize performance

And the result? Inconsistent sales, frustrated teams, and stalled growth.

The good news? This isn‚Äôt a sales problem‚Äîit‚Äôs a system problem.

Here's the 6 Pillars of a Scalable Sales System:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Clear Offer Positioning ‚Äì If you can‚Äôt explain your value, don‚Äôt expect reps to.
2Ô∏è‚É£ Defined Ideal Customer Profile (ICP) ‚Äì Selling to everyone = selling to no one.
3Ô∏è‚É£ A Repeatable Sales Process ‚Äì Every rep follows the same proven framework.
4Ô∏è‚É£ Lead Generation & Outreach Strategy ‚Äì Where do leads come from? How do you engage them?
5Ô∏è‚É£ Tracking & Optimization ‚Äì What gets measured gets improved‚Äîdata fuels growth.
6Ô∏è‚É£ Sales Automation & Tech Stack ‚Äì Your sales machine should work 24/7, even when you‚Äôre not.

The best sales people don‚Äôt just work hard‚Äîthey work within a system that‚Äôs built for success.

Fix the system first‚Äîthen scale.

postsData.content:
Your prospect loves your solution‚Äîbut that doesn‚Äôt mean they‚Äôll buy it. Here‚Äôs why.

Most sales training focuses on two core skills:

1. Qualifying for fit and need
2. Positioning your solution in a compelling way.

And that‚Äôs all important.

But does that sound like enough to you?

It shouldn't.

There‚Äôs something missing.

You become aware of this when you think you‚Äôve done everything right. You qualified the prospect, ran a killer demo, handled objections, and even got a verbal yes.

Then they go with someone else.

Why?

It has nothing to do with you, your pitch, or your product.

It‚Äôs about the internal boxes the prospect needs to check before they can buy.

They fall into 4 categories:

1. Decision Criteria
‚Äì What are the key factors influencing their decision?
‚Äì Is cost the main driver, or are they prioritizing functionality, support, or scalability?

2. Decision Process
‚Äì What‚Äôs their usual path to purchasing a solution like yours?
‚Äì Who needs to be involved?
‚Äì Are there approvals or legal reviews that could slow things down?

3. Decision Timeline
‚Äì Is there a deadline or compelling event pushing this forward?
‚Äì Can you work together to create a business case and gain mid-cycle approval?

4. Budget and Source of Funds
‚Äì Do they have executive buy-in, or will they need help securing it?
‚Äì Is there a budget already set aside, or do they need to justify the spend?
‚Äì What does their procurement process look like?

These 4 categories are often called BANT‚ÄîBudget, Authority, Need, and Timeline.

If you aren‚Äôt testing for them throughout the sales cycle, you‚Äôre leaving too much to chance.

Because even if they love your solution, even if they need it‚Ä¶

If they can‚Äôt check these boxes, the deal won‚Äôt close.

Train your team to sell with this in mind.

Keep closing.

Like what you read? Ô∏è Repost it to your network and follow Steve Litzow for more.

Want to accelerate your sales? Join our community of CEOs & Sales Leaders subscribers today:

postsData.content:
AI is the most powerful tool we ever had at our fingertips. However, It is not a magic wand. But, you can do MAGIC WITH AI, if you...

- Don't forget the goal
- Have a well-defined strategy
- Create and follow a solid process

Too many people jump to the final tactic of a long process. For example:

"You are an expert blog writer... Write me an amazing blog post about X"

But to write an amazing blog post you need to:
- Have a well-defined target audience
- Understand their pain points, needs, and wants
- have clear content pillars that serve them
- Perform keyword research
- Research information that would provide real value to your audience
- Create a draft that incorporates all of the above
- Audit the draft
- and then... you can write an amazing blog post

The good news is that you can use AI to help you in each of these steps. but jumping to the final step and thinking you will get great results will lead to poor results.

The same is true for every business process for which you would like to apply AI for efficiency.

And I know what you are thinking - great points Isar, but how do I actually do this across my team, my department, and the entire organization?

If you have ideas on how to do this please share in the comments. If you are looking for ideas on how to do this, please send me a DM.

BIOMIMICRY CONTINUUM ‚Äì Part 4 ‚Äì Update Agent LEARNING
Fundamental evidence of learning is the ability to recall and utilize what is learned. Receiving and integrating new information is a starting point. It is not learning, but an exceedingly small subset.
Recent research published in Nature uncovered that Concept Cells help our brain abstract information and build memories. (,)

A report in Quanta magazine () provides an example: The idea of a ‚Äúbank‚Äù has its own set of concept cells, maybe millions of them. Concept neurons fire for their concept no matter how it is presented: in real life or a photo, in text or speech, on television or in a podcast. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs more abstract, really different from what you‚Äôre seeing,‚Äù said Elizabeth Buffalo, a neuroscientist at the University of Washington.

These discoveries support and align with the abstraction methodology discussed in Part 2 and the contextualization methodology in Part 3.



In contrast to how the brain learns, LLMs:
-process all ingested data rather than filtering for relevance, and
-output the detailed words and pixels based on statistical proximity rather than conceptual value
The aim is to pass the Turing test, output that imitates the appearance of intelligence sufficiently to deceive the user.

The correctness of the result is dependent on the concentrations of relevant data in the training content. AI speed hides the fact that the model does not ‚Äúknow‚Äù anything but rather recomputes even identical prompts.

On the other hand, by imitating the learning and memory architecture and methodology of the brain the Agentic Expertise Ecosystem creates a library of reusable expertise and continues to learn. Imagine the applications when expertise is in high demand but sparse due to "brain drain" scenarios, new science and technology, or economic constraints.

In part 5 I will discuss the curation methodology.
postsData.commentAdded: Fascinating insights! Bridging brain learning with AI capabilities can redefine expertise in our rapidly evolving landscape. Looking forward to part 5!

Everyone's sharing their 2025 goals. I wrote anti-goals instead. It changed everything.


See, I'm the type who wants to do everything:

‚Ä¢ Launch a YouTube channel
‚Ä¢ Build multiple products
‚Ä¢ Speak at conferences
‚Ä¢ Create online courses
‚Ä¢ Start a podcast
‚Ä¢ Write a book

But with a 2.5-year-old toddler and family commitments, that's a recipe for disaster.

So, I flipped the script.

Before I started my business,, 4 months ago, I created a "Must Not Do" list for year one:

1. No long-form YouTube videos
2. No hiring full-time employees
3. No launching another course
4. No spreading myself too thin
5. No video podcast

The result?

Clarity. Focus. Peace.

Anti-goals aren't about limiting yourself.

They're about protecting your most valuable resources:
‚Ä¢ Your time
‚Ä¢ Your energy
‚Ä¢ Your family moments

At this stage in my career, those are the things that matter most.

Here's the truth:

You can do anything, but not everything at once.

Sometimes, the path to success isn't about what you do.

It's about what you consciously choose not to do.

What's on your anti-goals list for 2025?

GTM executive terminated after 10 months of employment and witnessing and experiencing systemic sexism and discrimination. 

Offered only 1 week of severance and partial bonus. This is after delivering on all her goals and meeting all KPIs. During her tenure, she received nothing but praise from her manager.

Another one of many victims of the systemic and blatant discrimination against women in the company.

I consulted with an extremely impressive customer support leader named Jenna. Despite receiving nothing but praise throughout her tenure, she was terminated just 4 weeks after the arrival of a new boss.

During those 4 weeks, the new boss did everything in his power to make Jenna miserable and drive her out of the company.

He made changes to her role, publicly humiliated her, alienated her team against her, questioned her value and contributions, and suggested she should resign.

In addition, he questioned Jenna about her age and made frequent comments about her appearance and protective motherly tendencies.

Jenna like many women in the organization were regularly dismissed and treated in a disrespectful manner. As the highest-ranking female on the executive team, many female employees regularly came to Jenna in confidence sharing stories of bias and discrimination.

Jenna brought these concerns to human resources including her observations that only 1 female was hired out of the last 17 new hires announced by the company. Women were often given administrative tasks regardless of their seniority, where men were not.

Every single woman in leadership was either demoted, resigned or managed out. Sharon was the last one standing.

Jenna was terminated with no complaints of performance, no PIP, no warning, just told they were going in a different direction and her position was eliminated.  Jenna was offered only 1 week of severance and most of her quarterly bonus.

A few weeks later, Jenna‚Äôs manager hired a former colleague of hers from a prior company to take Jenna‚Äôs eliminated position.

Jenna reached out and worked with us to put together a counter response to their wrongful termination and pathetic severance offer. We put together a scathing document laying out a compelling case.

After 2 weeks of negotiations, the employer agreed and increased their offer from 1 week of severance or $4,250 to 20 weeks or $90,500, a 1900% increase from the initial offer.

In addition, Jenna got 6 months of COBRA paid out as a lump sum and grossed up for taxes and the remaining of her bonus that was not originally offered.

Overall, we helped Jenna increase her offer by more than $100k as she realized an ROI of 6778% on her initial investment with us.

The outcome was beyond her wildest expectations, and she is thrilled to have come across us on LinkedIn.

Every severance offer should be negotiated.

postsData.content:
Ace Your Job Hunt: Resume and Interview Tips!

 Crafting Your Resume

1Ô∏è‚É£ Tailor for Each Job: Customize your resume to align with the job description. Use relevant keywords!

2Ô∏è‚É£ Highlight Achievements: Focus on quantifiable results (e.g., "Increased sales by 20%" or "Streamlined processes saving 10 hours weekly").

3Ô∏è‚É£ Simple Format: Keep it clean, concise, and professional. Skip fancy fonts and graphics.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Proofread: Typos can cost you opportunities. Use tools like Grammarly or ask a friend to review.

 Nailing the Interview:


1Ô∏è‚É£ Research the Company: Understand their mission, values, and recent achievements. Mention them during the interview.

2Ô∏è‚É£ STAR Technique: Structure your answers with Situation, Task, Action, and Result for behavioral questions.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Ask Questions: Show enthusiasm and curiosity by asking about team goals, company culture, or growth opportunities.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Stay Calm: Practice common questions and rehearse your elevator pitch to boost confidence.

 Preparation = Success!


1Ô∏è‚É£ Mock Interviews: Practice with peers or online tools to improve delivery and body language.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Skill Up: Leverage platforms like Coursera, LinkedIn Learning, or YouTube to sharpen relevant skills.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Network: Connect with professionals on LinkedIn. Engage with posts and join groups in your field.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Follow Up: A short thank-you email post-interview leaves a positive impression.

 The job hunt can be challenging, but persistence and preparation pave the way to success.

Stay motivated and keep growing!

 What‚Äôs your top tip for job seekers?

Let me know in the comments!
postsData.commentAdded: Great tips! I‚Äôd add that networking can open doors‚Äîdon‚Äôt underestimate the power of connections in your job search!

Paul Ladipo
Paul Ladipo
postsData.content:
If you're against DEI, just say it with your whole chest: you are against diversity, equity, and inclusion. Or a combination of the three.

Just to show you how much people know about DEI, all they think about is the acronym. All they think about is the hiring aspect. All the anti-DEI folks know is they're supposed to hate DEI.

Well I hate to break it to you, but if you oppose DEI, you are literally opposing efforts to include, serve, and accommodate America's diverse populations.

When the US experienced a powerful, yet brief racial awakening after George Floyd's death, racist white men gaslit the public into thinking they were the new oppressed minority. And it worked. Many women and people of color bought this narrative, not realizing they were harming themselves in the process.

And other vulnerable populations including but not limited to: veterans, persons with disabilities, and religious minorities.

We need to let go of the DEI is anti-white narrative. There is room for everyone at the table. Problem is, there are folks who don't WANT everyone at the table. It's time we stopped listening to them.



Image description: Snapshot of a Tweet describing the ridiculousness of opposing DEI.
postsData.commentAdded: Well said! DEI isnt a zero-sum game‚Äîits about creating a richer, more equitable environment for everyone. Lets champion inclusivity together! üåç‚ú®

ùêçùê®ùêßùê©ùê´ùê®ùêüùê¢ùê≠ùê¨ ùê¢ùêßùêØùêûùê¨ùê≠ ùê°ùêûùêöùêØùê¢ùê•ùê≤ ùê¢ùêß ùêöùê≠ùê≠ùê´ùêöùêúùê≠ùê¢ùêßùê† ùêßùêûùê∞ ùêùùê®ùêßùê®ùê´ùê¨. Surprisingly, too many of us drop the ball post-contribution. Donors are met with silence, waiting weeks for an acknowledgment of their gift ‚Äî if one comes at all. This delay is not just discourteous‚Äîit's detrimental. Every day a donor remains unengaged decreases the likelihood of further contributions, significantly reducing their lifetime value.

We all get dazzled by the allure of new prospects. But what about the donors already on board?

Prompt and thoughtful engagement can turn a new donor into a lifelong supporter. A donor who feels valued and sees the impact of their contribution is far more likely to deepen their commitment.

Effective donor management isn't just good manners; it's a strategic imperative. It builds a community of supporters who aren't just contributors but are true partners in your mission.

Our study of 126,000 first-time donors underscores this: Fast, regular, and highly personal acknowledgments, immediately followed by the next ask, radically improve both donor retention and lifetime value.

Beyond the Logo: The Power of Sonic Branding

Tired of your brand being just a visual? It's time to give it a voice! Think Netflix's "Ta-Dum" or Titan's elegant melody ‚Äì sonic branding creates an audio identity that resonates deeply.

At, we believe in the power of sound. We wanted our brand to reflect courage, compassion, and delight ‚Äì the essence of Veera, Karuna, and Hasya. So,crafted a unique soundscape for us that embodied leadership, innovation, and empathy. This isn't just a jingle; it's an experience woven into every customer interaction, from marketing campaigns to everyday touchpoints.

Sonic branding is the future of brand communication, and we're proud to have created an audio identity that truly captures the spirit of TATA Realty.
